intro: Lesquerella berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces distinctive, elongated pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Lesquerella berlandieri is adapted to arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and a deep root system. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential agricultural applications.
